settings.text: A drug called Adderall XR is used to treat ADHD, or attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. It stimulates the central nervous system by raising brain levels of the neurotransmitters dopamine and norepinephrine. The oral capsule form of Adderall XR is offered and should be taken once daily. This article is written to provide information to Welzo users so they can better understand Adderall XR.

Adderall XR's most frequent negative effects include:

head pain

- Having trouble sleeping

- mouth-drying

- Appetite loss

- Losing weight

- abdominal pain

- dizziness

Among the less frequent side effects are:

- Stress

- irritation

• aggressiveness

- the hallmarks of psychosis (hallucinations, paranoia, and delusions)

Consult your doctor if you experience any of the aforementioned side effects. It's important to consult a doctor before taking Adderall XR because it might not be appropriate for everyone.

A stimulant of the central nervous system, Adderall XR. It functions by raising the brain's concentrations of the neurotransmitters dopamine and norepinephrine. These neurotransmitters control how we feel, pay attention, and behave. Adderall XR raises these levels, which helps to alleviate ADHD symptoms.

Dosages:

There are three different dosages of Adderall XR:

– 5 mg

– 10 mg

– 25 mg

Adderall XR's starting dose is typically 10 mg once daily. Depending on how well Adderall XR works for you and how well the side effects are tolerated, your doctor may change your dose.

Not everyone is going to be a good fit for Adderall XR. Before beginning this medication, it's crucial to speak with a doctor. Please make sure to tell your doctor about all of the medications you are taking because Adderall XR may interact with other drugs.

Please seek immediate medical attention if you experience any severe side effects.
